intro: Hieracium djimilense subsp. galatinum, commonly known as the Galatinum hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal and stem leaves that are usually hairy and have a lobed or toothed margin. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
